Press conference clip from Baltimore mayor as she "appears" to give "protesters" permission to riot or as she says "room to destroy"......
I wonder how she feels about that comment tonight with 7 officers injured annd businesses looted and burned, oh and the governer calling in the national guard.
Fox News just said the rioters cut a fire hose that was being used to extinguish the fire they set at the CVS they looted and burned.
Might be time to begin charging people with Inciting a Riot for their idiotic statements.......
Please tell me that was just a Freudian slip. She couldn't possibly have meant that. I suspect she just needs to work on communication skills.
She is just one of the examples of the trash we have running government positions. The governor had to step in and get the National guard on the streets of the city now.
Another Democrat Incompetent in a government position. No surprise here. <img src="styles/default/xenforo/clear.png" class="mceSmilieSprite mceSmilie12" alt="o_O" title="Er... what? o_O">
Now she says the press "mischaracterized" her statement... "We didn't endorse it. We didn't allow it."
She is now in the lead in the latest Moron of the Year award.
Well it looks like Rev. Al is coming to town too.

Sharpton said the march from Baltimore to Washington is designed to bring Gray's case — as well as others before him, including Walter Scott, who was shot by a police officer in North Charleston, S.C. — to the attention of Loretta Lynch, the new U.S. attorney general.
"Ms. Lynch, in her new role that we all supported, must look and intervene in these cases," Sharpton said. "Justice delayed is justice denied."
Sharpton was invited to Baltimore by the Rev. Westley West of Faith Empowered Ministries, among others.
Well praise be. If the Rev. Al is coming it must be going to be calm and violence free... <img src="smilies/head2wall.gif" class="mceSmilie" alt=":wall:" title="Head2wall :wall:">

In her defense I listened to the Mayor's later press conference, about 7:30 ET, and I thought she explained her previous statement quite well. While I haven't heard the first statement she seems rather level-headed and the way she explained what she said it does seem as though some members of the media may have seized on words out of context. Two members of the city council also spoke and it's clear they have all learned from Ferguson - the big lesson will be if they don't hesitate to bring in LOTS of National Guard to put a clamp on things before they get further out of hand.

So far at least Nevillebama hasn't stuck his foot in his mouth like he and Holder did in Ferguson - yet - but you can always count on "Taxcheat Al" Sharpton to stir the simmering pot and spill gas on the flames as soon as he sees a news camera rolling.

I tried to watch the opening clip but it's impossible to get the full context when you can't hear the reporter's question to which she is responding. But what I could get out of it was they were trying to allow peaceful protest - rightfully so - while stopping rioters and looters. Granted, there's a fine line there - only takes a matter of minutes for a crowd of the first to become a roving gang of the other. But she gives the impression at least of being on top of the situation as best she can - whether that's true remains to be seen. Big test for the new Gov. Hogan too. Let's see if they've learned anything and not prejudge their performance by the initial violence.
....... Let's see if they've learned anything and not prejudge their performance by the initial violence.

So Rev. Al Sharptongue is a-comin' to town! Praise be and hallelujah! We can get the Dog&Pony Show really hopping now! Maybe if they ask nicely and pony up a couple hundred grand, they can coax ol' Jesse into bringing his Rainbow Bus in too.
She is letting her inner thugger out, speaking from her heart.

Reports from Monday night indicate maybe they haven't learned their lessons. Today is the time to bring the NG in in major force and allow the police dept to aggressively round up looters and rioters. This is likely the last chance they'll get before we see weeks of violence perpetrated by outside forces stirred up by none other than the Great Al. Her words have not been backed up by impressive performance so maybe I was wrong.
